intro: Stenogyne hirsutula, commonly known as the hairy stenogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Stenogyne hirsutula is known for its small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
